titleStmt.title: A brand taken out of the fire. Or The Romish spider, with his webbe of treason. VVouen and broken together with the seuerall vses that the world and Church shall make thereof. By T. Cooper, preacher of Gods word.
titleStmt.author: Cooper, Thomas, fl. 1626.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by G. Eld [and Thomas Purfoot] for Iohn Hodgets, and are to be sould at his shop in Paules Church-yeard,

notesStmt.note: "The third part of the treatise" has separate pagination; register is continuous.
Running title reads: The Romish spider.
A variant has "Gathered out of the 64. Psalme." in place of the statement of responsibility.
Identified as STC 5705 on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
